title: Rosemary's Baby - movie title font
content:
Looking to name this font, please!   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110153847im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/71002.jpg)   
   
Thanks in advance,   
   
Matt Atherton
author: fluiddruid23

comments.content: looks like it was based on Tiffany
nonononono..... what is the name of it????
could it be the bastard son of Caslon 224?

Oooh...this is getting interesting...   
   
Talk about split personality! ;o)

BTW, I don't think thats the "movie title font", I think it's from a book cover.   
   
This is what advertisements of the movie looks like:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110153847im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/71013.jpg)   
   
What is that typeface? Is it customized Helvetica or..?

Hmm… The (bold) Helveticas I know doesn’t have such strongly upward-pointing y-tail. The tails of a’s are also weird, shouldn’t such strong weight of Helvetica “loose its tail”?

I wonder if this is a lighter helvetica made heavier by stroking, that would explain some of the weirdness going on. Or is this some old photolettering version?

(Ooh…editing a post without the dontlooklikecrap-hassle:))
